Tots Time: Thursdays in term time, 9.30am to 10.30am and 11am to 12pm

Tots group for babies, toddlers and pre-schoolers and their grown ups. Songs, Bible stories, sensory activities. Socialising for children and adults. Hot drink and biscuit included for adults. Â£1 per session.

St Thomas' Kids Club: Thursdays in term time, 5.30pm to 6.30pm

Kids club for children in Reception-Year 6. Friends, games, Bible, fun. Â£1 per session.

Knit and Natter: Tuesdays, 9.30am to 12pm

Knit and Natter is a friendly group of people who enjoy crafts. Â£3.50 per session which includes refreshments.

Golden Folks: First Tuesday of the month, 1pm to 3pm

Golden Folks is an over 60âs group. There is usually a speaker or an activity. Â£5 per session which includes tea/coffee and cake.

Thom's Blokes: Third Tuesday of the month, 1pm

For men of all ages. For some meetings we take a trip out to a nearby place of interest. The cost of these visits depends on the admission price at the venue. Alternatively we meet at 1pm in the Church Centre to listen to a guest speaker â the cost then is Â£3 per person. Talks range over a wide variety of topics.

title: Church of St Mary the Blessed Virgin, Addington

address: 1, Highland Road, London, Greater London, SE19 1DP, United Kingdom
description:
Christ Church, Gypsy Hill is open  as a warm space, with activities, food, company & conversation.


When: Tuesday from  11:00 am - 12:00 pm

Activity: Moving into Wellbeing

If you would like to get moving again; if you are a little creaky around the joints or hoping to find muscles you never knew you had, come and join our 'Moving into Wellbeing' group. You will get a very warm welcome, and a gentle chair-based introduction into movement exercises at a pace you can cope with.

Come and give us a try - it's free, friendly, and fine just to turn up!


When: Tuesday  from 12:00 pm - 2:30 pm

Activity: Open Door - Community Drop In

All are welcome to join us around the lunch table - with an opportunity to chat and join in the range of activities that are offered from time to time.


Activity: Open Door Community Choir - open to all!

When: Tuesday from 1:45 pm 

Come and join in with our new community choir - whether you are a long-time singer or have never tried to sing a note before, we aim to have lots of fun making music together.


Where: Christ Church, Gipsy Hill 1, Highland Road SE19 1DP

Visit our website for details of other weekly events that require registration.

https://www.gipsyhill.org.uk/


Parking, WiFi, Accessible Toilets, Hot Drinks, Charging Facilities, Child Friendly

In addition, on Christmas day we are open 11am, and will be serving a 4 course meal in great company, all for free, but attendees must book their place beforehand to give us an idea of numbers. To book a place simply email Philip.Layton@salvationarmy.org.uk

hours._text:
Salvation Army in Upper Norwood is opening as a free warm space, with tea and coffee on offer and good company on the following days and times: 

 Wednesdays 2pm-3pm *

Thursdays 2pm-3:30pm *

Fridays 6:30pm-7:45pm *

Sundays 10am-1pm


* We break between 17th Dec - 9th Jan (but Sundays continue throughout Christmas).


In addition, on Christmas day we are open 11am, and will be serving a 4 course meal in great company, all for free, but attendees must book their place beforehand to give us an idea of numbers. To book a place simply email Philip.Layton@salvationarmy.org.uk

description: Kingston Library is open to everyone, is free of charge and you'll receive a warm welcome. You can come and get involved in an activity, such as adult and children's colouring, puzzles and board games or just come and read the newspaper or pick up a book, charge your phone, use the free wifi or a computer. Hot drinks are available. We have a children's area for reading or borrowing books, a space where they can do their homework or attend an event or activity. To check our opening hours please go to https://www.kingston.gov.uk/library

As well as being well connected with city wide partners, groups and communities, through projects and partnership working. Our services are delivered from the centre and out in the community through our outreach team. the centre is open from 9:30am - 4pm. our services are delivered in different community languages through our diverse team of staff.

Monday: 2pm to 5pm Warm Hub (visitors can read, use the internet, talk, and have tea and coffee). Older men can also join Franks Club at the same time.
Tuesday: 9.30am to 2pm Warm Hub (visitors can read, use the internet, talk, and have tea and coffee). 2pm to 4pm Forget-Me-Nots for older people who want to maintain their memory.
Wednesday: 9.30am to 1pm Warm Hub (visitors can read, use the internet, talk, and have tea and coffee). 1.30pm to 3.30pm (older people are welcome to join in with arts and crafts social activities).
Thursday: 9.30am to 4pm (any older person is welcome to join in with positive ageing activities.
Friday: 9.30am to 4pm (any older person with vision impairment is welcome to join in with our regular Crusoe Club activities, with a two-course lunch for £6).

hours._text:
Open every Friday 1pm to 3pm.
Link Age Southwark, in partnership with the United Reformed Church (URC), will be offering a free hot lunch and afternoon social session. Lunch will be provided by the URC and will consist of home-made soup and a bread roll. There will also be board games and activities available for local residents aged over 60 and those with a diagnosis of dementia. Family members and carers are also welcome to attend with the person they support.

Opening times

  • 21 November 2022 (12 noon onwards)
  • 12 December 2022 (12 noon onwards)
  • 19 December 2022 (12 noon onwards)

The Dragon Café brings people together to join in creative activities such as creative writing sessions, a singing group, poetry, drawing, mindful meditation, and a dance group. The emphasis of these activities is always to have fun and to feel connected to other members of the community. These events also provide much needed connection with peers and an opportunity to socialise and will provide free food for those who attend.
